# weekdayOrdinal

**Instance Property**

The ordinal number of weekdays.

## Declaration

```swift
var weekdayOrdinal: Int { get set }
```

## Discussion

Weekday ordinal units represent the position of the weekday within the next larger calendar unit, such as the month. For example, *2* is the weekday ordinal unit for the *second* Friday of the month.

This value is interpreted in the context of the calendar with which it is used—see [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Cocoa/Conceptual/DatesAndTimes/Articles/dtCalendars.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40003470] in [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Cocoa/Conceptual/DatesAndTimes/DatesAndTimes.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/10000039i].

## Accessing Weeks and Days

- **weekday**: The number of the weekdays.
- **weekOfMonth**: The week number of the months.
- **weekOfYear**: The ISO 8601 week date of the year.
- **day**: The number of days.
- **week()**: Returns the number of weeks.
- **setWeek(_:)**: Sets the number of weeks.
